title: Investors, Beware of Tech Posers
sub_head: If a company isn’t really a technology platform, history shows buying the hype will cost you
body:
If salad chain Sweetgreen is positioning itself as a tech company, you only have yourself to blame.
Chasing astonishing valuations, an avalanche of companies have purported over the past few years to be technology platforms when they are at their core something very different. Investors grumble, but then go right on fueling the fire: Sweetgreen, for instance, which is expected to go public on Thursday, is now looking at a valuation of roughly $2.7 billion. It sells what it says are “plant forward” meals out of 140 “digitally driven” restaurants nationwide.
